alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:53AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Franklin, eastern Stephens, eastern Rabun, Hart, western Anderson, western Pickens and Oconee Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 553 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Clayton to 11 miles southwest of Seneca to 7 miles southeast of Carnesville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Clemson, Seneca, Hartwell, Walhalla, Carnesville, Homeland Park, Central, Northlake and Pendleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains
